Preparation for cellenONE X1 single-cell isolation procedure

Change the wash bottle with fresh doubly deionized water (with resistivity of 18 MΩ cm at 25°C) produced by deionized water purifier and then empty the waste bottle.
Place the recovery vial (100 μL microcentrifuge tube) and wash tray (a 2 cm × 1.5 cm × 5 cm accessory) in position. Add 20 μL 70% ethanol or 1× PBS (reuse the dispensed cells) to the recovery vial.
Note: Before starting the cellenONE X1 system, make sure there is nothing that could prevent the axis from moving freely in the enclosure.
Press the power button.

Preparation for preprocessing of fresh or cryopreserved samples for single-cell droplet generation
Timing: 20 min
This section describes the process of preparing the cell suspension prior to single cell sorting.
Critical: The process should be performed on ice to ensure cell viability, except for the enzymatic incubation process.
Shred and dissociate tissue.
Rinse the tissue with pre-cooled dulbecco’s phosphate buffered saline (DPBS) and remove the tissue into a 2 mL small centrifuge tube.
Add 500 μL 0.05% collagenase IV and cut the tissue into pieces on ice, dissociate at 37°C for 8 min.
Then 70 μm filter is used to filter the lysate and stop digestion with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS)-containing dulbeccos modified eaglemedium (DMEM).
Centrifugation at 500 × g, 4°C, 5 min, then discard the supernatant and resuspend with FBS-containing DMEM.
Lysis of red blood cells.
Lyse the red blood cells in suspension by adding an appropriate volume (approximately 3 times the volume of cell suspension) of red blood cell lysis buffer.
Quantification of cell number and viability.
Mix 10 μL cell suspension with an equal volume of 0.4% Trypan Blue and then load onto a cell counting chamber slides. Insert into the cell counter (Invitrogen, AMQAX1000, User guide[href=https://assets.thermofisher.cn/TFS-Assets/BID/brochures/cell-counter-that-thinks-like-cell-biologist-countess-3-brochure-zh.pdf?SID=fr-countess2cnzh-5]) for cell number and viability assay.
Note: Keep the rest of the samples on ice or store at −80°C.
Single cell sorting
Timing: 10 min

The process mainly describes the sorting of prepared cell suspensions to obtain individual cells by the celleone single cell sorting system.
Resuspend the sample. Place it in the machine.
Aspirate 10 μL.
Check drop volume and set parameters.
Open CellenONE module.
Click “D” to take a reference background image. Click the Background button only when the nozzle is free of cells and/or particles and when PDC is in front of the camera.
Change the sample name to “particle size nozzle type volume”
Click “M” to do the mapping procedure.
Check the remaining volume.
Critical: The isolation needs 4–5 μL. If it is not enough volume left, flush PDC and aspirate sample again.
Note: Change to “standby” mode when the sample was already aspirated but no movements were taken more than 30 s.
Click run to start the isolation and cells are sorted into these 8-tube strips (Open Z movement when using high 96-well plates).
Flush PDC immediately after isolation.

The relative uniformity values (RUVs) for 8 loci are calculated as follows: Relative uniformity value (RUV) = 2 -(Cti-Ct0). Cti denotes the Ct value of the locus in sample i, and Ct0 denotes the Ct value of the same locus in the unamplified genomic DNA. RUV of unamplified genomic DNA should be 1. An RUV closer to 1 indicates a more uniform amplification of the locus.
Critical: Samples with RUV values between 0.25 and 4 for at least 6 of the 8 loci are selected for library construction.3[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib3]
Single-cell whole-exome library construction
Timing: 2–3 days
This section describes sample preparation for paired- end multiplexed exome library preparation.
Sample preparation
Genomic DNA fragment.
Shear the DNA. 65 μL DNA was sheared to 150–200 bp by Covaris M220.

Critical: The parameters are set as follows: peak power: 75, duty factor: 20%, cycles: 200, time: 250 s, and temperature: 18°C–22°C.
Purification.
Mix AMPure XP beads suspension thoroughly.
For each sheared DNA sample (approximately 65 μL), add 90 μL AMPure XP beads. Mix with a pipette ten times.
Incubate samples at 20°C–25°C for 5 min.
Put the tube on a magnetic separator. Wait for the solution to clear (3–5 min). Discard the supernatant carefully.
Add 200 μL of 70% ethanol to each tube while keeping the tube in the magnetic stand. Remove the ethanol after 1 min. Repeat the wash procedure.
Seal the wells, spin, return to the magnetic stand and remove all ethanol. Airdry the samples (3–5 min).
Add 25 μL NF water to each tube, mix thoroughly, and incubate for 2 min at 20°C–25°C.
Put the tube on the magnetic stand, wait until the solution is clear. Transfer the supernatant (∼ 24 μL) to a new tube.
Assess quality (optional). Refer to the reagent kit guide of 2100 Bioanalyzer instrument to perform the quality control process. The DNA fragments peak at 150–200 bp in size.
Repair the ends.
Prepare End Repair master mix on ice, mix thoroughly.

Hybridization and capture
Timing: 16 or 24 h
This section describes the steps to hybridize prepared gDNA libraries with a specific probe capture library. After hybridization, the target molecule is captured on a streptavidin bead.

Prepare 1.7 μL of a 221 ng/μL dilution of each library if the DNA concentration is higher than 221 ng/μL.
For libraries concentration below 221 ng/μL, concentrate the samples using a vacuum concentrator as described in the user guide[href=https://www.thermofisher.cn/document-connect/document-connect.html?url=https://assets.thermofisher.cn/TFS-Assets%2FLED%2Fmanuals%2F80302051ES.pdf].
Transfer each 1.7 μL gDNA library (375 ng) to a separate tube, sealed and keep on ice.
Prepare the Hybridization Buffer at 20°C–25°C, Warm the buffer for 5 min at 65°C if a precipitation forms. Until used, keep it at 20°C–25°C.

Maintain the hybridization tube at 65°C, transferring each hybridization mixture to the tube containing 100 μL of washed streptavidin beads. Mix thoroughly by pipet.

Note: During the final wash, ensure that all the wash buffer has been removed.
Add 15 μL NF water to each tube, mix well by pipette. Until used, keep the samples on ice.

Once the PCR amplification has been completed, spin the tube briefly.
Purification.
Detailed steps are as follows:
Mix AMPure XP beads suspension thoroughly.
For each 25 μL amplified DNA sample, add 45 μL AMPure XP beads. Mix with a pipette ten times.
Incubate samples at 20°C–25°C for 5 min.
Put the tube on a magnetic separator. Wait for the solution to clear (3–5 min). Discard the supernatant carefully.

Dispense 200 μL of 70% ethanol into each tube while keeping the tube in the magnetic stand. Remove the ethanol after 1 min. Repeat the wash procedure.
Seal the tubes, spin, return to the magnetic stand and remove all residual ethanol. Airdry the samples (3–5 min).
Add 15 μL NF water to each tube, mix thoroughly, and incubate for 2 min at 20°C–25°C.
Put the tube on the magnetic stand, wait until the solution is clear. Transfer the supernatant (∼15 μL) to a new tube.
Pause point: If the experiment does not proceed, store the sample at −20°C.
Assess the quantity and quality of the libraries.
Refer to the reagent kit guide of 2100 Bioanalyzer instrument to perform the quality control process. The peak of DNA fragment size should be 250–350 bp. Qubit 4.0 was used to measure each library’s concentration.
Stopping Point: If the experiment does not proceed, store the libraries at −20°C.
Sequencing.
The constructed exome libraries can be sent to a commercial facility for sequencing.
